question: Good afternoon, I need to order a reference proving that I am a student of the University.
answer: Good afternoon! To order a reference proving your student status, you can access MyUniversity. Select the "Academic Reference" option and specify the required number of copies. This reference takes 5 working days to produce. Once it's ready, you can visit the 319 hallway to check the reference box and collect your proof of enrolment.
generated_answer:
Good afternoon! To order a reference confirming that you are a student at Innopolis University, you can follow these steps:

1. Go to MyUniversity and log in.
2. Click on the "Order Reference" button.
3. Select "Reference on studying" as the type of reference you want to order.
4. Choose the number of copies you need and for whom you are ordering it (yourself or another institution).
5. Fill out any additional information, such as your preferred language for the reference (if applicable).
6. Submit your request and wait for the reference to be processed.

Please note that the processing time for references may vary depending on the type of reference you order. For "Reference on studying," it takes 5 working days to produce. You can pick up your reference from room 319 in the hallway. If you have any further questions or concerns, please feel free to ask!

question: Hello, I am an international student. Do I need to do anything when I arrive at Innopolis?
answer: Hello! Upon your return to Innopolis University, as an international student, promptly upload your migration card and passport scans within three days on My University's "Migration Card" section. Then, submit visa details in the "Visa" section, followed by uploading your new registration card scan and related information in the "Registration" section. Non-compliance incurs a 2000 ruble late fee at Verkhny Uslon's Migration department and potential deportation after two violations. It's crucial to follow these guidelines upon arrival to avoid penalties or deportation.
generated_answer:
Hello! As an international student, there are a few things you should take care of when you arrive at Innopolis University:

1. Check-in with the dormitory administration on the 1st floor of the 3rd dorm or text @Inno\_dorm for any questions about your accommodation and meal plan. The basic facilities in the dorm include WiFi zone, set of bed linen and towels, hygiene kit, maintenance room cleaning, 24-hour laundry room, drinking water on each floor, free parking, use of stove and air conditioner, duplicate keys making, and luggage storage.
2. Familiarize yourself with the migration control rules at Innopolis University to ensure that your presence in Russia is legal. As an international student, it is important to abide by migration control regulations to avoid penalties or possible deportation. You can find the instructions for all international students in the "Migration Control" section of your personal account on My University.
3. Join the International students' telegram channel and contact @Daria\_cider if you have any questions.

It is important to note that pets are not allowed in the dorms, and hours of silence are from 10pm to 7am. Alcohol, cigarettes (including hookahs, electronic cigarettes, etc.), drugs, and offensive behavior are forbidden on the territory of the campus. Also, be careful while cooking and do not block fire detectors. If you need to bring guests, you'll need to arrange a guest pass for them, and to bring them overnight, you'll have to book a place via dormitory website.

Please make sure to upload required documents on time to avoid paying "late fee" worth 2000 rubles in the Migration department of Verkhny Uslon. Two failures will lead to your deportation. So please pay attention to the expiration date of your documents!

question: What are AI courses for Bachelor Science students?
answer:
- [CSE301 — Philosophy II - Introduction to Artificial Intelligence](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Introduction_To_Artificial_Intelligence)
- [CSE302 — Introduction to Machine Learning](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Introduction_To_Machine_Learning)
- [CSE303 — Introduction to Big Data](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Introduction_To_Big_Data)
- [CSE304 — Game Theory](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Game_Theory)
- [CSE305 — Data Mining](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Data_Mining)
- [CSE306 — Information Retrieval](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Information_Retrieval)
- [CSE307 — Introduction to Computer Vision](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Introduction_To_Computer_Vision)
- [CSE308 — Practical Machine Learning And Deep Learning](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Practical_Machine_Learning_Deep_Learning)
- [CSE310 — Statistical Techniques for Data Science and Robotics](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Statistical_Techniques_For_Data_Science)
- [CSE311 — Natural Language Processing](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Natural_Language_Processing)
- [CSE340 — Nature Inspired Computing](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Nature_Inspired_Computing)
generated_answer:
AI courses for Bachelor of Science (BSc) students typically provide a comprehensive overview of artificial intelligence, including its history, theoretical foundations, and technological stack. These courses aim to equip students with the necessary knowledge and skills to understand AI's structure, and to practice contemporary AI technologies and frameworks such as reasoning, natural language processing, computer vision, and machine learning.

Throughout the course, students work on a variety of AI problems individually and in teams, solving issues from scratch and using existing solutions. Topics covered may include introduction to AI, reasoning approaches, natural language processing for syntax and semantic analysis, speech processing, image and video processing with OpenCV and machine learning, as well as recommendation and classification practicum.

Upon completion of the course, students are expected to have gained a deep understanding of artificial intelligence, its history, theoretical basis, and practical applications. They should also be proficient in implementing AI technologies and frameworks, solving AI problems, and possessing a strong foundation for further studies in the field.

question: What are open access resources, literature and reference materials for NLP course for Bachelor students?

- Clark, Alexander, Chris Fox, and Shalom Lappin, eds. The handbook of computational linguistics and natural language processing. John Wiley & Sons, 2013.
- Dan Jurafsky and James H. Martin. Speech and Language Processing (3rd ed.)
- Géron A. Hands-on machine learning with Scikit-Learn and TensorFlow: concepts, tools, and techniques to build intelligent systems. – " O'Reilly Media, Inc.", 2019. SECOND EDITION

	+ The Hugging Face Transformers library [link]
	+ Google’s AIY Projects [link]

question: What are the Eligibility criteria for Exchange programs?
answer:
**Semesters available for exchange:** - Bachelor's level: 3, 4, 5, 6 or 7 - Master's level: 2 or 3

**Trimesters available for exchange:** - Bachelor's level: 4, 5, 7, 8

**GPA required:** - regular exchange: 4.0 or higher - Erasmus+: 4.4 or higher.

You should also check the entry requirements of the partner university at its website.

- Bachelor's level students must have available semesters 3, 4, 5, 6 or 7, while master's level students must have available trimesters 2 or 3.
- You should also check the entry requirements of the partner university at its website.
- For regular exchange, a minimum GPA of 4.0 is required. For Erasmus+ program, a minimum GPA of 4.4 is required.

question: If I am a teacher, is it necessary to share studying material only in moodle? Can I send materials as it is convenient for me?
answer: You can upload tasks to Moodle in advance and hide them from students, and open them when necessary. You can share a link to a chat/Telegram channel with students for assignments from Moodle.
generated_answer:
Yes, as a teacher, you have the flexibility to choose how you share study materials with your students. You can upload tasks to Moodle in advance and hide them from students, or you can share materials through other platforms such as email, chat/Telegram channels, or even make them available on your personal website.
However, using Moodle for sharing study materials has some advantages:
* It centralizes all course-related materials and resources in one place, making it easier for students to access and keep track of them.
* You can easily manage and track student submissions and progress within the platform.
* Students can interact with each other and ask questions through Moodle's built-in forum or messaging system.
Ultimately, the choice depends on your preferences and how you think it would best serve your students' needs.

question: Where to find information about Academic Leave procedure?
answer:
The basis and procedure for granting academic leave are prescribed in paragraph 5 of the "Regulations on the procedure and grounds for transferring, expelling and restoring students and granting academic leave to students in the Autonomous Non-profit Organization of Higher Education "Innopolis University", at the link: https://innopolis.university/sveden/document .

For more information, you can contact the Student Support and Development Department, office 319, or [the bot of this department](https://t.me/StudentAffairs_bot).
